page.title: 15HALLATON BOTTLE-KICKING 2
page.content: After this, everyone parades to the Butter Cross to decorate the Bottles with red, white and blue ribbons. The bottles are in fact three casks - one full of beer, and two dummies. The parade makes its way to the top of the hill outside the village called "Hare Pie Bank" where the rest of the pie is thrown to the crowd. The custodian of the bottles begins the bottle kicking contest between the youths of Hallaton and Medbourne - and elsewhere. He throws one of the bottles in the air three times and on the third time they scramble, quite violently on occasions, until it is carried over one of the two brooks which mark the boundaries of the contest. The winners - the first to "home" two bottles - usually Medbourne these days - carry the casks to the Butter Cross and drink the beer.
